attributes.description: Comprehensive PowerShell forensic monitoring query using hybrid approach: powershell_events table for Event ID 4104 (Script Block Logging) with automatic script reconstruction, plus windows_eventlog for Event ID 4103 (Module Logging) and Event ID 4688 (Process Creation). Detects obfuscated commands, fileless malware, and captures parent/child process relationships. Note: cosine_similarity anomaly detection is not available as it requires 'feature_vectors' config which is not supported by Elastic Agent's osquery integration. MITRE ATT&CK: T1059.001 (PowerShell).
attributes.query:
-- Comprehensive PowerShell Forensic Monitoring Query (Hybrid Approach)
-- Uses powershell_events for Event ID 4104 (Script Block Logging) with automatic reconstruction
-- Uses windows_eventlog for Event ID 4103 (Module Logging) and 4688 (Process Creation)
-- Focus: Fileless malware detection, obfuscated command tracking
-- MITRE ATT&CK: T1059.001 (PowerShell)
-- Last updated: 2025-12-08
--
-- PREREQUISITES:
-- 1. Windows Script Block Logging must be enabled (GPO or registry)
-- 2. Elastic Agent osquery integration requires this config in Fleet policy:
--    { "options": { "disable_events": "false", "enable_powershell_events_subscriber": "true", "enable_windows_events_subscriber": "true" } }
--
-- PERFORMANCE TIP: For large environments, add time filter to powershell_events:
-- WHERE time > (strftime('%s', 'now') - 86400)  -- last 24 hours

-- Part 1: Script Block Logging (Event ID 4104) via powershell_events
-- Benefits: Automatic script reconstruction across fragmented blocks
SELECT
    datetime,
    time,
    4104 AS eventid,
    'Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell' AS provider_name,
    NULL AS level,
    NULL AS task,
    NULL AS computer_name,
    'Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational' AS channel,
    NULL AS pid,
    NULL AS tid,
    NULL AS data,
    NULL AS ps_provider_name,
    NULL AS context_info,
    NULL AS payload,
    script_block_id,
    script_block_count,
    script_text,
    script_name,
    script_path,
    NULL AS command_line,
    NULL AS process_name,
    NULL AS parent_process_name
FROM powershell_events

UNION ALL

-- Part 2: Module Logging (Event ID 4103) via windows_eventlog
-- Captures obfuscated command context and payload
SELECT
    datetime,
    NULL AS time,
    eventid,
    provider_name,
    level,
    task,
    computer_name,
    channel,
    pid,
    tid,
    data,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.ProviderName') AS ps_provider_name,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.ContextInfo') AS context_info,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.Payload') AS payload,
    NULL AS script_block_id,
    NULL AS script_block_count,
    NULL AS script_text,
    NULL AS script_name,
    NULL AS script_path,
    NULL AS command_line,
    NULL AS process_name,
    NULL AS parent_process_name
FROM windows_eventlog
WHERE 
    channel = 'Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational'
    AND eventid = 4103

UNION ALL

-- Part 3: Process Creation (Event ID 4688) via windows_eventlog
-- Captures command line and parent/child process relationships
SELECT
    datetime,
    NULL AS time,
    eventid,
    provider_name,
    level,
    task,
    computer_name,
    channel,
    pid,
    tid,
    data,
    NULL AS ps_provider_name,
    NULL AS context_info,
    NULL AS payload,
    NULL AS script_block_id,
    NULL AS script_block_count,
    NULL AS script_text,
    NULL AS script_name,
    NULL AS script_path,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.CommandLine') AS command_line,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.NewProcessName') AS process_name,
    json_extract(data, '$.EventData.ParentProcessName') AS parent_process_name
FROM windows_eventlog
WHERE 
    channel = 'Security'
    AND eventid = 4688
    AND data LIKE '%powershell%'

ORDER BY datetime DESC;
